question: Which war was ended by the "United Nations Security Council Resolution 598"?
explanation: Iran-Iraq War was ended by the "United Nations Security Council Resolution 598". United Nations Security Council resolution 598, (UNSC resolution 598) adopted unanimously on 20 July 1987, after recalling Resolution 582 and 588, called for an immediate ceasefire between Iran and Iraq and the repatriation of prisoners of war, and for both sides to withdraw to the international border. The resolution requested the Secretary-General to dispatch a team of observers to monitor the ceasefire while a permanent settlement was reached to end the conflict. It became effective on 8 August 1988, ending all combat operations between the two countries and the Iranâ€“Iraq War.
